protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
description:
Case 2: Fix samples. Use this protocol when long term storage of slide is required.

For when you can count your samples in a few days, see Case 1.
protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

sub_authors.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University
Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Li Deng
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

components.data: Prepare buffer glutaraldehyde:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare buffer glutaraldehyde:
Formulation for a phosphate-buffered 20% glutaraldehyde stock solution.
source_data.protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

versions.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Li Deng
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

source_data.guidelines:
Solution A Solution B
Na2HPO4 1.414g in 50ml 0.02µm filtered mQ NaH2PO4 1.058g in 50ml 0.02µm filtered mQ

components.data: Prepare solution A and solution B as found in guidelines
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare solution A and solution B as found in guidelines

components.data: Prepare the phosphate buffere by adding 15.25 ml solution A and 9.75 ml solution B in 25 ml 0.02 µm filtered mQ
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the phosphate buffere by adding 15.25 ml solution A and 9.75 ml solution B in 25 ml 0.02 µm filtered mQ

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Buffered glutaraldehyde
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

components.data: Add 40 ml of 25% glutaraldehyde to 10 ml phosphate buffer for a 20% buffered glutaraldehyde solution
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 40 ml of 25% glutaraldehyde to 10 ml phosphate buffer for a 20% buffered glutaraldehyde solution

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Buffered glutaraldehyde
source_data.annotation: This is most often used for transmission electron microscopy so purchase a TEM-grade glutaraldehyde (from a vendor such as Ted Pella) for preparing this buffered reagent
source_data.thread_text: This is most often used for transmission electron microscopy so purchase a TEM-grade glutaraldehyde (from a vendor such as Ted Pella) for preparing this buffered reagent
source_data.body: This is most often used for transmission electron microscopy so purchase a TEM-grade glutaraldehyde (from a vendor such as Ted Pella) for preparing this buffered reagent
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

components.data: Adjust pH to 7 with NaOH
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adjust pH to 7 with NaOH

components.data: Store this 20% buffered glutaraldehyde at 4 <sup>o</sup>C in the dark
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store this 20% buffered glutaraldehyde at 4 <sup>o</sup>C in the dark

components.data: Make dilution of virus prep in 0.02 µm filtered seawater to a concentration of ~E+07 particles ml<sup>-1</sup>
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make dilution of virus prep in 0.02 µm filtered seawater to a concentration of ~E+07 particles ml<sup>-1</sup>

components.data: Fix viral sample with 20% buffered glut to a final concentration of 0.5%
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix viral sample with 20% buffered glut to a final concentration of 0.5%

components.data: Incubate at 4°C for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 4°C for 30 min.

components.data: Prepare working solutions of SYBR Gold
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare working solutions of SYBR Gold

source_data.protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Li Deng
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

components.data: Thaw the commercial stock of SYBR Gold in the dark at RT
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thaw the commercial stock of SYBR Gold in the dark at RT

components.data: Centrifuge at ~3000 rpm for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at ~3000 rpm for 5 minutes

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of SYBR Gold working solutions
source_data.annotation: Because SYBR Gold is in DMSO.
source_data.thread_text: Because SYBR Gold is in DMSO.
source_data.body: Because SYBR Gold is in DMSO.

components.data: Dilute SYBR Gold in 0.02 µm filtered TE buffer to 100x (10 µl in 990 µl TE buffer)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute SYBR Gold in 0.02 µm filtered TE buffer to 100x (10 µl in 990 µl TE buffer)

components.data: 0.02 µm filter the diluted SYBR (100x)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 0.02 µm filter the diluted SYBR (100x)

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of SYBR Gold working solutions
source_data.annotation: This working stock can be stored at -20°C and re-thawed one time.
source_data.thread_text: This working stock can be stored at -20°C and re-thawed one time.
source_data.body: This working stock can be stored at -20°C and re-thawed one time.

components.data: Add 2 µl of SYBR working stock in 98 µl 0.02 µm filtered mQ in a plastic Petri dish, 4 drops in one dish
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2 µl of SYBR working stock in 98 µl 0.02 µm filtered mQ in a plastic Petri dish, 4 drops in one dish

components.data: Cover the dish by aluminum foil
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the dish by aluminum foil

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)

components.data: Set up the filtration unit, connecting it to a vacuum
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set up the filtration unit, connecting it to a vacuum

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.annotation: Set up the vacuum no higher than 5 mm Hg.
source_data.thread_text: Set up the vacuum no higher than 5 mm Hg.
source_data.body: Set up the vacuum no higher than 5 mm Hg.

components.data: Add a few drops of 0.02 µm filtered mQ on the filter base
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a few drops of 0.02 µm filtered mQ on the filter base

components.data: Place a 0.2 nitrocellulose filter (the support filter) on top of the water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a 0.2 nitrocellulose filter (the support filter) on top of the water

components.data: Switch on the vacuum, the support filter should be flat on the filter base
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch on the vacuum, the support filter should be flat on the filter base

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.annotation: This support filter is good for several samples as long as it remains flat and no air bubbles between filter and base.
source_data.thread_text: This support filter is good for several samples as long as it remains flat and no air bubbles between filter and base.
source_data.body: This support filter is good for several samples as long as it remains flat and no air bubbles between filter and base.

components.data: Add a few drops of 0.02 µm filtered mQ on the support filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a few drops of 0.02 µm filtered mQ on the support filter

components.data: Switch on the vacuum to pull the water through
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch on the vacuum to pull the water through

components.data: Apply a 0.02 µm Anodisc filter over the support filter
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply a 0.02 µm Anodisc filter over the support filter

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 14 of SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.annotation: Make sure no air bubbles between filters.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure no air bubbles between filters.
source_data.body: Make sure no air bubbles between filters.

components.data: Apply the filter tower and clamp while vacuum is on
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply the filter tower and clamp while vacuum is on

components.data: Switch off the vacuum and add viral samples
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch off the vacuum and add viral samples

components.data: Switch on the vacuum and wash filter set with ~1 ml of 0.02 µm filtered mQ
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch on the vacuum and wash filter set with ~1 ml of 0.02 µm filtered mQ

components.data: Remove the filter while the vacuum is still on
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the filter while the vacuum is still on

components.data: Rinse tower in 1L Q-water in between samples
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse tower in 1L Q-water in between samples

components.data: Blot onto paper towel to dry
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Blot onto paper towel to dry

components.data: Dry filter membrane on Kimwipes at RT completely
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry filter membrane on Kimwipes at RT completely

components.data: Remove membrane and place viruses side up on staining solution in the Petri dish for 15 minutes (cover with aluminum foil)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove membrane and place viruses side up on staining solution in the Petri dish for 15 minutes (cover with aluminum foil)

components.data: Dry filter membrane again on Kimwipes in the dark at RT completely
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry filter membrane again on Kimwipes in the dark at RT completely

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 23 of SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)
source_data.protocol_name_html: SYBR Gold Staining for Viral Enumeration (Case 2)

components.data: Pipet 20 µl antifade solution on a microscope slide
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet 20 µl antifade solution on a microscope slide

components.data: Place the stained filter membrane on top of it
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the stained filter membrane on top of it

components.data: Pipet 30 µl antifade solution on a cover slide
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet 30 µl antifade solution on a cover slide

components.data: Carefully place it on the filter to avoid bubbles
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully place it on the filter to avoid bubbles

components.data: Place slide at -20°C to enhance fluorescence
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place slide at -20°C to enhance fluorescence

components.data: Read slides using 100x oil immersion objective and inverted fluorescent microscope
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Read slides using 100x oil immersion objective and inverted fluorescent microscope
